question: Teacher A starts with concrete examples of sentences as contrasted with sentence fragments then asks the class to differentiate sentence fragments from sentences. Which method does Teacher A apply?
There are non-verbal interventions in classroom management. Which among the following is a VERBAL intervention?
Student Y asks a question, but the teacher doesn’t know the answer. What is the best action in this situation?
choice1:
Tell them that you have studied it in the past, but that you have forgotten about it
now.
choice2: Tell the student that it is an interesting question and you will get back with an answer.
choice3: Give it as an assignment to the student who asked the question.
choice4: Ignore the question and entertain another one.
answerKey: Tell the student that it is an interesting question and you will get back with an answer.

question: Exercises should be organized so that each student can work independently at his or her own level of ability and rate of learning.
choice1: Practice must follow understanding and can enhance understanding
choice3: Practice should be organized so that students experience high rates of achievement
choice4: Practice should be specific and systematic

question: What field of education manages children with behavioral problems like attention-deficit disorders?
Good discipline is characterized by
In the 5'S Formula to create a conducive learning environment, which S stands for cleanliness of the work place?
Research says that students' motivation is likely to vary as a function of age, culture, gender, and socio-economic background. What does this imply?
choice1: Preschoolers are easier to motivate than high school students.
choice2: Boys are more difficult to motivate than girls.
choice3: There is no single best method in motivating learners.
choice4: Children from deprived homes are less motivated than children from affluent homes.
answerKey: There is no single best method in motivating learners.

question: There is  a district Math contest.  What is the best way of selecting the representatives to showcase the human/social functions of school?
choice1: Select Mark Dave who ranks second but has the financial capability to pay for tutors.
choice2: Select Joshua who comes from a poor family yet endowed with mathematical skills.
choice3: The teacher conducts competitive exams in Math to determine the best representative.
choice4: The teacher appoints students to participate.
answerKey: The teacher conducts competitive exams in Math to determine the best representative.

question: Time in school can be divided in different categories relating to academic work. This time refers to the number of days and hours in school calendar specified by state and school district laws.
“What is the plot of the story?”. The question belongs to what type of verbal entry?
How can a slow learner completely learn a particular skill in school?
choice1: Present to him the lesson once.
choice2: Present to him the lesson thrice or more in varied forms.
choice3: Present to him the lesson twice using the same technique.
choice4: Keep on repeating the lesson for a month.
answerKey: Present to him the lesson thrice or more in varied forms.

question: What is the most effective way to distribute papers/ materials in class?
choice1: Instruct pupils to "Get one and pass".
choice2: Ask a leader pupil to distribute the papers.
choice3: Give pupils papers one by one
choice4: Let pupils come to the teacher one by one
answerKey: Instruct pupils to "Get one and pass".

question: This classroom arrangement is best for creating inclusivity among students especially during the first week of the school year wherein teacher and students get to know each other by introducing themselves to the class.
Metacognitive processes favorably influence learning. Which does NOT belong to metacognitive processes?
What may cause a poor classroom instruction?
choice2: Wholesome physical conditions of the classroom

question: A child who is having difficulty containing himself is asked to do an errand. By the time he comes back, the rest of the class has calmed down. Which classroom management technique was employed?
Teacher X is discussing about suffrage. One of the students asks if it is all right not to exercise it. Select the best option for Teacher X to facilitate the internalization of that concept.
choice1: Teacher X lets students simulate the election process then discuss the activity.
choice2: Teacher X lets students make a concept map.
choice3: Teacher X lets students conduct needs assessment of a community.
choice4: Teacher X discusses through PowerPoint presentation all about suffrage.
answerKey: Teacher X lets students simulate the election process then discuss the activity.

question: These tasks involved the application of familiar skills and ideas to new problems.

Teacher has been constructivist in his approach to lesson planning. What must the features of his lessons?
I.   Students are engaged in learning.
II.  Students guide their own learning and meaning-making.
III. Students keep the learning to themselves.
IV. Students are not encouraged to share their thoughts about a new concept for that calls for much time.

Teacher Q wants his students to become critical thinkers. Which teaching practice is/are aligned?
I. Using situational multiple choice tests
II. Rote memorization of facts, formula
III. Determining flaw of reasoning in an argument
A teacher who says "Girls are emotional and very sensitive while boys are not" is practicing gender.
Teacher Cleo observed that the preschool children have generally short attention and interest span. What kind of class activities should select for them?

To build strong and healthy relationship in class which should be out of the picture?
I.  Criticizing			III. Befriending
II. Listening			IV. Blaming

The teacher of the class attended an emergency meeting so the student teacher took over. The students were very noisy and some groups were quarreling.  She talked to them and called their attention but they did not listen. She could no longer control the whole class, what should have been done by the student teacher?
choice1: Get their attention by telling a story.
choice2: Give them test in order for them to stop.
choice3: Give them some group works to present.
choice4: Walk out and tell the teacher at the other room of what is going on.
answerKey: Give them some group works to present.

question: In their English subject, teacher Jhen give activities in phonics instruction, listening to stories, and discussion of library books and elements in language. The actual amount of time she spends on specific content refers to
Each teacher has a role as a behavior reinforcing agent. Which of the following should not be encouraged among teachers?
Among teaching styles, how do you classify teachers who lack confidence in enforcing and demanding compliance to rules?

Miss Able wants to let her class learn that in the formation of ice cubes, the surrounding surface of the water freezes first before the others and to show that I water expands rather than contracts when frozen. Which of the following is the most appropriate teaching strategy for her to use?
Teacher P wants students to monitor their own learning. Which teaching behavior of Teacher P will be of help?
choice1: Keeping the learning outcomes to herself
choice2: Providing students with a clear scoring rubric
choice3: Challenging students by giving difficult tasks
choice4: Leaving the students to help themselves
answerKey: Providing students with a clear scoring rubric

question: Applying the principle, “the more senses  that are involved, the more effective  the learning  becomes”  which instructional   technology  should be utilized?
Which of the following best characterize the Business Academic Approach in classroom management?

Among mistaken goals in the Acceptance Approach to discipline, what happens when students are not getting the recognition they desire, continually seek help, and refuse to work unless the teacher hovers over them?
Asking a series of questions to a student is a violation of which technique in questioning?

Among examples listed, which does NOT represent teaching strategies to develop 
metacognition?
choice1: Have teachers the free hand to monitor and rate leaning achievement
choice2: Have students develop questions about what is going on around them
choice3: Have students to monitor their own learning and thinking
choice4: Have students make predictions about what is to be represented
answerKey: Have teachers the free hand to monitor and rate leaning achievement

question: Child obeys blindly
choice1: Child understands the meaning of rules
choice2: Child has opportunity to express his/her opinion
choice3: Child given punishment is related to the misdeed
choice4: Child has opportunity to express his/her opinion
answerKey: Child has opportunity to express his/her opinion

question: Computer-assisted instruction refers to the use of computers by
choice1: the student to aid in accomplishing some task.
choice2: the student  and teacher  to aid in some task and facilitate learning.
choice4: the teacher and the school for  the systematic control and organization of aspects of instruction.

question:
As an effective classroom manager, what should a teacher do?
I.	She uses instructional time wisely.
II.	She uses her expert power to derogate her students
III.	She puts to use available and appropriate materials.
IV.	She manipulates colleagues and students so she can meet her goals.
Which is not a characteristic of effective classroom management?
choice1: Teacher tells students of the objectives of the lesson
choice2: Teacher tells but doesn’t practice procedures.
choice3: Teacher has discipline plan and post assignments
choice4: Students are working on tasks while being assisted by teachers.
answerKey: Teacher tells but doesn’t practice procedures.

question: Below are the following results if a teacher manifested “thrust” in her class. Which among the options is not included?
A student is late to school every morning. It would be best for the teachers to
choice2: ask the child for an excuse slip from his parents.
choice3: send the child to the guidance office

question: Among teaching styles, how do you classify teachers who clearly and fairly communicates standards for discipline and performance to student?
Some children in Teacher Pauline’s class want to do better in order to receive extra points for them to boost their grades. Which of the following best reflects this situation?

Borich  identified three types of classroom climate that the teacher can use in different situations- competitive, co-operative and individualistic. Which  classroom climate is/are  LEAST threatening? 
I. Competitive
II. Cooperative 
III. Individualistic
Among teaching styles, how do you classify teachers who are control oriented and impose rules without explanation?
An IQ test is given before admission which is used by schools to determine general intelligence which has _________ that measures specific attributes to students.
Among variables for instruction, which matters most, such as the rest would not mean so much without it?
choice1: Incentives to work on instructional tasks

question: Which of the following routines is the best way to start a class?
choice3: Asking the children to clean the room

question: Classroom routines form the backbone of daily school activities, but which of the following is NOT covered by such routines?
A student once said: "I don't like to recite because my barkada who is not academically performing sarcastically laughs at me". What does this point to?
choice1: A student has the tendency to put blame on a factor outside himself for non-performance.
choice2: Cognitive factors influence a student's attitude   toward class participation.
choice3: Group influence can impact on a student's orientation toward learning.
choice4: The impact of group influence on a student's thinking is the student's choice.
answerKey: Group influence can impact on a student's orientation toward learning.

question:
Which is/are characteristics of a culturally responsive teaching?
I.   Crosses disciplines and cultures to engage learners while respecting their cultural integrity
II.  Accommodates the dynamic mix of race, ethnicity, class, gender, region, religion, and family that contributes to every 
     student's cultural identity
III. Presents some cultures to be superior than others to improve inferior cultures
Andrew is very willing to learn multiplication, but he has tendency to mix up multiplication and division. What student problem is described?

According to Robert Slavin, the four components of instruction must be adequate for the instruction to be effective. It is like a link in a chain, and the chain is only as strong as its weakest link. Which of the following does not belong to Slavin’s Component of Instruction?
choice1: Incentives to work on instructional tasks

question: Bellack believes that teachers dominate in verbal activities in the classroom. The teacher-student ratio in words spoken is 3:1. This evidence corresponds with Flanders’ finding that teachers’ talk is ___ percent of classroom activity.
According to the guidelines on punishment, what does it mean if the teacher should give the student the benefit of the doubt?
choice1: Make sure facts are right before punishing
choice3: Get the side of the students when punishing
choice4: Don’t punish and doubt effectiveness of punishment
answerKey: Get the side of the students when punishing

question: According to Good Brophy (1984), how should a teacher give a punishment?
choice3: punishment should be threatened and warned before implemented.
choice4: punishment should be given constantly even you are in good or bad mood
answerKey: punishment should be threatened and warned before implemented.

question: After Ms. Rivas planned her lesson in English, she found out that the materials at hand do not match her objectives. Which is the best thing that she can do?
choice1: Teach the lesson the following day.
choice3: Carry out the lesson as planned and use the materials at hand.
choice4: Change the objectives to match with available materials.

question: Among styles of classroom management, which expects teachers to specify rules of behavior, consequence for disobeying them, and to communicate these rules and consequences clearly?
As preventive measure for classroom discipline, the teacher may restructure the program. How is this not done?
choice2: Remove tension level before proceeding with lesson

question: Which  practice  is aligned  to Maslow’s hierarchy of needs?
choice1: Telling   a sick child that  sickness is only in the mind.
choice2: Allowing children  to do their personal necessities  when needed.
choice3: Leaving the child  to freely choose his learning activity  to  put him at ease
choice4: Making children  compete against  one another to draw the best  from each child.
answerKey: Allowing children  to do their personal necessities  when needed.

question: For group guidance in classroom management, what element is lacking when there are  tensions among individuals, cliques and subgroups, or student- teacher friction?
How will  I develop my lesson plan if I want to develop   my students’ skill to draw generalizations?
In the context  of Bruner’s theory  of learning,  if a teacher teaches  in the iconic level , what  do I use?

Either drill should be self-scoring or teacher-scored, with correct answers provided – and should be done as soon as possible. The teacher needs to know scores or results in order to know if he or she can proceed to the next point of skill.
choice1: Practice should be organized so that students experience high rates of achievement
choice2: Practice material should provide progressive continuity between learning tasks
choice3: Practice material should be used for diagnostic purposes
choice4: Practice should be organized so that students and teacher have immediate feedback
answerKey: Practice should be organized so that students and teacher have immediate feedback

question: How does a behaviorist  explain  the observation  of  a child enjoying  school?
choice1: He  is rewarded  for  his good performance
answerKey: He  is rewarded  for  his good performance

question: If schools want students to become self-directed learners, which strategy should they employ more?

For a positive learning environment, it is good to make clear that an individual's beliefs and activities should be understood by others in terms of that individual's own culture. Which concept is explained?
How will you make a child memorize the table of multiplication from the point of view of PAVLOV?
choice1: Model the recitation of the table of multiplication.
choice2: Reward the child with a candy for every correct recitation.
choice3: Call the child's attention every time you recite the table for them.
choice4: Make them understand the meaning of multiplication.
answerKey: Call the child's attention every time you recite the table for them.

question: I want  my pupils  to  find the  rule on  adding similar fractions after I have  given them sufficient examples of similar  fractions  with their  sums. Which method  should I use  in my lesson plan?

Facilities such as classrooms, fixtures, and equipment can often damage the morale of new teachers and become an obstacle for adapting well to the school environment. What should be the policy for assigning said physical facilities?

If a teacher works on an intrinsic motivation framework to help develop intrinsic motivation among learners, which motivational conditions form part?
I.    Establishing inclusion—creating a learning atmosphere in which students and teachers feel respected by and 
      connected to one another.
II.   Developing attitude—creating a favorable disposition toward the learning experience through personal relevance and 
      choice.
III   Enhancing meaning—creating challenging, thoughtful learning experiences that include student perspectives and 
      values.
IV.  Engendering competence—creating an understanding that students are effective in learning something they value.

Education Supervisor  from the Department of Education  explains  to student teachers that the content in  Science must be used   in the teaching of language  skills in English in Grade I. Which approach  is the Education Supervisor promoting?
Describing entries ask for an explanation or description about something. Which among the following questions belong to Describing entry?
choice1: Can you summarize the major points of the book?
choice3: How do you feel President Bush will be judged by historians?

question: If your approach to teaching is constructivist, which  class behavior  is  observable?
choice1: Students understand compound words by creating  their own compound words  using comic strip
choice2: Teacher  introduces and develops the lesson without interruption.
choice4: Students  don’t  ask questions as these are signs  of inattention.
answerKey: Students understand compound words by creating  their own compound words  using comic strip

question: In a constructivist lesson planning approach, which is UNACCEPTABLE?
choice1: Learners confront their understanding in the light of new learning.
choice2: Learners are helped to construct understanding based on what they already know.
choice3: Learners accommodate change in their understanding as a result of new understanding.
choice4: Learners accept blindly what teacher teaches because she is an authority on the subject.
answerKey: Learners accept blindly what teacher teaches because she is an authority on the subject.

question: For problems of discipline that cannot be resolved in class, which of the following should NOT be done as it reduces the authority of the teacher?
choice1: Give students a chance to redeem himself
choice2: Rely on others to resolve your classroom problems
answerKey: Rely on others to resolve your classroom problems

question: If a teacher has set objectives in all domains or learning targets and which could be assessed using a single performance task, what criterion in selecting a task should she consider?
If I want   to teach my students  how to play chess, which method of  lesson development is most appropriate?
How may teachers manifest good time management in school?
choice1: By engaging in income generating activities
choice2: By socializing with other teachers in the department
choice3: By devoting their time in instructional activities
choice4: By spending their free time in leisure activities
answerKey: By devoting their time in instructional activities

question: I want to be highly objective in checking answers to an essay test. Which can help?
choice1: Correct all students’ answers in one number first before you go to the second
choice3: Know  whose answers you are reading
choice4: Correct all the answers of one student after another.
answerKey: Correct all students’ answers in one number first before you go to the second

question: If I apply Vygotsky’s theory of learning, which   will I do?
choice1: Assist the child  where he needs assistance until he can be on his own.
choice2: Follow a logical arrangement of topics
choice3: Establish classroom discipline  from the very start.
choice4: Allow the child to choose his  learning activity.
answerKey: Assist the child  where he needs assistance until he can be on his own.

question: In a favorable learning environment, which competition promotes learning?
choice2: Within members of the same gender

question: How would  you make your students  look forward  to coming to school everyday from the point of view of B.F. Skinner’s reinforcement theory?
choice1: Make use of mental drills in the classroom.
choice2: Always end your lessons with a clear  summary.
choice4: Convince  them  of the importance  of education.

question: In a classroom situation where students are discussing whether government efforts to establish peace in Mindanao will be beneficial to the whole country or not, which is the most appropriate strategy?
If you apply Edgar Dale’s Cone of Experience in teaching,  which  would you do?
choice1: Use one audio-visual  aid at a time.
choice2: Connect  the  concrete and the abstract.
choice4: Avoid the use  of the  chalkboard since it has been overused.
answerKey: Connect  the  concrete and the abstract.

question: In a number of researches on classroom management, of all the variables, classroom management has the largest effect on student achievement. Which can be inferred from the finding regarding classroom management?
choice1: Students cannot learn in a chaotic, poorly managed classroom.
choice2: The effect of classroom atmosphere on the learner is dependent on the learner.
choice3: Teacher is the single most important factor in the learning of a child.
choice4: The classroom atmosphere is mainly teacher's creation.
answerKey: Students cannot learn in a chaotic, poorly managed classroom.

question: I want to  help Chemistry students develop and practice research skills by using  a laboratory similar  to that of a real laboratory before the students use the riskier, more expensive real equipment. What traditional  technology   shall I use?

Develop positive classroom pride is one way of creating positive learning climate. Which practice contributes to the development of a positive classroom pride?
I.   Display student work
II.  Reinforce students verbally
III. Be proud of the class's achievements
I want to help my students retain new information. Which one will I use?
How and when should teachers most effectively deal with misdemeanor for class management and control?
Mrs. Martinez observes that her students answer even when not called, shout "Ma'am" to get her attention, and laugh when someone commits mistakes. What should she do?
choice1: Set the rules for the class to observe.
choice2: Involve the whole class in setting rules of conduct for the whole class.
choice3: Send a report/letter to the parents about their child's misbehavior in class.
choice4: Send misbehaving students to the guidance counselor.
answerKey: Involve the whole class in setting rules of conduct for the whole class.

question: Of the following, which is a non-threatening style of disciplining unruly students?
choice1: Stand under heat of the sun

question: Instructional tasks are the core of the classroom setting. Most classroom tasks are initiated by teachers; students usually act in response to teachers expectations. Among the categories of tasks, it aimed at making new skills and ideas automatic so they can be used in other tasks situations.
Ms. Saplan is planning to do an assessment of learning. Which of these should she include in her plan considering her purpose for assessment?
choice2: How to give immediate feedback to student's strengths and weaknesses
choice4: How to determine the area of interest of learners

question: Some children are more active than others, as everyone knows extremely high levels of activity or hyperactivity are considered problematic. How may a teacher help a child who is hyperactive?
choice1: Make him the leader of the class.
choice3: Allow him to spend longer at the playground until he gets tired.
choice4: Give him challenging activities that are appropriate to his ability level and interests.
answerKey: Give him challenging activities that are appropriate to his ability level and interests.

question:
Peer tutoring is the assignment of students to help one another on a one-to-one basis or in small groups in a variety of situations. Which of following statements are the types of pairing students according to Ornstein?
i.	Students may tutor others within the same class
ii.	Students help younger ones on a one-on-one basis or one-to-a-group basis within the class or outside the class
iii.	Two students may work together and help each other as equals with learning activities
iv.	Older students may tutor students in lower grades outside of the class
Internal summaries: chunking strategies , Final summaries : _____________.
Problems of discipline (misdeeds, lapses, minor offenses) can be reduced through enthusiasm which can be matched by the enthusiasm of learners. What can draw a laugh and reduce tension from all?
Policies are a matter of group discussion and decision
choice2: Decision  is left entirely to students.
choice3: Decision  is a monopoly of the teacher
choice4: Decision  is a monopoly of the teacher
answerKey: Decision  is a monopoly of the teacher

question: Samantha belongs to a poor family but she is endowed with talents and skills. During written examinations she gets very high scores but during recitations she has inferiority complex. Which is the best way of developing her potential?
choice1: Inspire her by showcasing success stories.
choice2: Make her a leader and presenter in group activities.
choice3: Develop her self-confidence by forcing her to recite.
choice4: Make her a representative in school activities.
answerKey: Make her a leader and presenter in group activities.

question: Of subcategories of movement behavior, what is happening when the teacher ends an activity abruptly?
Increasing latency periods when questioning students helps create a positive learning atmosphere. Which practice contradicts this principle?
choice1: Quickly give up on a student who is struggling with a response.
choice2: Call only on students with hands raised so as not waste time waiting.
choice3: Answer the question yourself if no student can answer your question.
choice4: Make a conscious effort to extend the length of wait time before student can give a response.
answerKey: Quickly give up on a student who is struggling with a response.

question: Of the approaches to classroom management, which emphasizes the organization and management of students as they engage in academic work?
Mr. Umayam is doing a performance-based assessment for the day's lesson. Which of the following will most likely happen?
choice1: Students are evaluated in one sitting.
choice2: Students are evaluated based on varied evidences of learning
choice3: Students are evaluated in the most objective manner.
choice4: Students do an actual demonstration of their skill.
answerKey: Students do an actual demonstration of their skill.

question: Planned ignoring, signal interference, and proximity control are techniques used in _____.

Research   indicates   that   on   the   average,   teachers   who   have   high-quality relationships with their students have 31 percent fewer discipline problems, rule violations, and related problems over a year's time than did teachers who did not have high-quality relationships with their students. What does this imply?
choice1: Students contribute most to the classroom atmosphere.
choice2: Teachers who are business-like are not good classroom managers.
choice3: The quality of teacher-student relationships is the keystone for all other aspects of classroom management.
choice4: Teachers who give way to students' demands are better in classroom management than those who are stern.
answerKey: The quality of teacher-student relationships is the keystone for all other aspects of classroom management.

question: My class is not a very good one and is hard up at drawing generalizations. Which approach to lesson planning  may be most efficient and effective?
Ms. Ortega tasked her students to show how to play basketball. What learning target is she assessing?
Learning is influenced by social interaction and interpersonal relations. What must a teacher do?
choice2: Motivate students to reflect on how they learn.
choice3: Make students feel good about themselves.

question: In what way are the results  of a formative assessment  utilized?
choice1: To evaluate the effectiveness of an innovative  teaching method
choice3: To guide teacher in her choice of teaching method
choice4: To measure the learning outcome  of  three-month teaching
answerKey: To guide teacher in her choice of teaching method

question: Ms. del Rosario rated her students in terms of appropriate and effective use of some laboratory equipment and measurement tools and the students ability to follow the specified procedures. What mode of assessment should Miss del Rosario use?

Mr. Cidro wants to test students' knowledge of the different places in the Philippines, their capital and their products and so he gave his students an essay test. If you were the teacher, will you do the same?
choice1: No, the giving of an objective test is more appropriate than the use of essay.
choice2: No, such method of assessment is inappropriate because essay is difficult.
choice3: Yes, essay test could measure more than what other tests could measure.
choice4: Yes, essay test is the best in measuring any type of knowledge.
answerKey: No, the giving of an objective test is more appropriate than the use of essay.

question: Positive interdependence as an element of collaborative learning means that the students must:
choice3: Learn to depend on each other to achieve a goal
choice4: Help one another in the individual test for everyone to pass
answerKey: Learn to depend on each other to achieve a goal

question: Mr. Sky wants to introduce new concept and encourage a large-scale discussion in their math class. What instruction must probably he would do?
Mr. Ravelas made an essay test for the objective "Identify the planets in the solar system". Was the assessment method used the most appropriate for the given objective? Why?
choice1: Yes, because essay test can measure any type of objective.
choice2: No, he should have prepared an objective test.
choice3: Yes, because essay test is easier to construct than objective test.
choice4: No, he should have conducted oral questioning.
answerKey: No, he should have prepared an objective test.

question:
Signal interference is an effective non-verbal strategy in managing off-task behaviors. In what way/s this can be done? 
i.Eye-to-eye contact	
ii.Facial Expression 	 
iii. Planned ignoring
iv. Using hand signals
Nate Gage recently analyzed 49 process-product studies. He identified four clusters of behaviors that show a strong relationship to student outcomes. The following belongs Gage Model, except
On managing the class group, what is the problem when the class atmosphere is punitive, tinged with partiality, too competitive or to exclusive?
choice4: Group emotions such as fear, depression, etc.

question: Judging the relative severity of common classroom management strategies, which of the following is LEAST severe if applied on erring students?
Principal Ted thinks uses free and open dialogue, even confrontation, so that teachers and learners can learn to discard old habits and attitudes. What is his general view about learning?
choice1: It is primarily a fun experience
choice2: It is a Consequence of experience
choice3: It is at times a painful process
answerKey: It is at times a painful process

question:
Which can help minimize memory deficit in learning?
I.   Using cues
II.  Establishing learning conditions that reduce interference
III. Using advanced organizers

Which elements must be present for goal setting to be an effective motivator tool?
I.   Goal acceptance
II.  Specificity
III. Challenge
IV. Performance monitoring
V.  Performance feedback
choice4: I, II, III, IV and V
answerKey: I, II, III, IV and V

question: Which of the following is NOT a learning benefit gained from Cooperative Learning Approach?
choice1: Each member has the tendency to compete with the other members in the group.
choice2: Students gain from each other's effort.
choice3: All members in a group share a common fate; they either sink or swim together.
choice4: Students feel proud when a group member is recognized for his/her achievement.
answerKey: Each member has the tendency to compete with the other members in the group.

question:
Which is/are usual behaviors of extrinsically motivated learners?
I.   Have to be enticed or prodded
II.  May process information only superficially
III. Often interested in performing only easy tasks	
IV. Meet only minimal classroom requirements

Which   of the   following   activities   must  the   teacher  consider   in  guiding assignments?
I. The teacher motivates students on the difficult portions of the assigned lessons.	
II. The method of attacking the assignment is explained.
III. The teacher requires that the assignment be properly recorded.
What do you call Ms. Anne’s teaching style when she serves as a role model towards learning, as well as occupational outlook, perhaps even towards general life?

Which are supposed to be aligned in an outcomes-based course syllabus?
I. learning outcomes
II. teaching-learning activities
III. assessment tasks
IV. teacher qualifications
Which of the following teacher actions exemplifies the generative approach of instruction? The teacher
choice1: provides explicit directions and explanations on how to do a task
choice2: provides opportunities to students to make own linkages to prior knowledge
choice3: presents information in an ordered sequence in which component sub-skills are taught directly
choice4: assumes responsibility for linking information with students' prior knowledge
answerKey: provides opportunities to students to make own linkages to prior knowledge

question:
Which of the following statements gives the real value of lesson-planning?
I. It helps the teacher to be orderly.
II. It helps the teacher recall the subject - matter previously taken.
III. It helps the teacher organize his activities.

Which instructional  method is aligned  to this lesson objective:  Given tabular  data on  weights and heights of  the school athletes , the student must be able to draw  conclusions regarding  correlation of   weights and heights of athletes..
With greater participation in mind, which is least to be included?
Which of the following is an acceptable teacher-effectiveness practice?
choice1: Directions given sparingly and delivered casually
choice2: Setting of objectives rather than outcomes
choice3: Planning done following monitoring of learning
choice4: Classroom routines done early in the school year
answerKey: Classroom routines done early in the school year

question: Which of the following is a programmatic type of teacher?
choice1: Ms. Tina Go analyzed her students’ work, diagnosed their errors, and presented corrective advice.
choice2: Mr. Wang So guides the students’ activities and facilitates self-instruction and independent learning.
choice3: Mr. Andy Lim facilitates the development of students’ ideas through dialogue and questioning.
choice4: Mr. Bob Oy is in command of the subject matter and explains particular aspects of the lesson.
answerKey: Mr. Wang So guides the students’ activities and facilitates self-instruction and independent learning.

question: The following are non-verbal behavior by teachers. Which one is an encouraging behavior?
choice2: Stands or sits that shows alertness
answerKey: Stands or sits that shows alertness

question: What behaviors is manifested by a student who has the high tendency not to complete work and activities?
Which of the following violates good discipline?
Which of the following marks a conducive environment?
What is the possible effect of an overcrowded curriculum?
choice1: in-depth learning tends to be given greater emphasis
choice2: Lifelong learning skills tend to be fully developed
choice3: There is lack of personal analysis and reflection on major concepts.
answerKey: There is lack of personal analysis and reflection on major concepts.

question: Which of the following is a correct example of the deductive method of teaching?
choice1: The lesson starts with the study of specific cases and ends with a generalization.
choice2: The teacher starts by defining a term then gives examples.
choice3:
The teacher asks the students to narrate their unforgettable experiences then
share their observations after.
choice4: The students ask questions to the teacher at the end of every discussion.
answerKey: The teacher starts by defining a term then gives examples.

question:
Which of the following is the correct practice in handling students' records?
I. Records are kept for safekeeping in filing cabinets.
II. Feedbacks about children's performance are given to parents.
III. Permanent records are brought home for teachers to accomplish.
IV. Records are accessible to any interested person to show transparency.

Without misuse of learning time, Teacher Odie requests students with singing talent to perform in class, adding to make learning a source of fun. What facilitating environment is Teacher Odie adopting?
choice2: Recognizes right of students to make mistakes

question: Which is  the primary role of the school head?
choice1: To decide on  who  among the students should pass
choice2: To confer  with parents regarding  performance of their children
choice3: To help the teachers so they can teach to  the best of their abilities
choice4: To teach  subject/s  that  no teacher can teach
answerKey: To help the teachers so they can teach to  the best of their abilities

question: Which one is in support of greater interaction?
choice3: Not allowing a student to complete a response

question: Which of the following situations illustrates the best way of maintaining an atmosphere conducive to learning during the experiment period?
choice1: Materials needed for experiments are to be bought just before using them to avoid wastage.
choice2: Learners carry on class experiments following the procedure quietly and systematically.
choice3: Handling, distributing and collecting of materials or equipment are routinized.
choice4: Experiment tables and chairs are arranged in rows facing the teacher's table and chair.
answerKey: Handling, distributing and collecting of materials or equipment are routinized.

question: To construct useful representations of knowledge and to acquire the thinking and the learning strategies necessary for continued learning success across the life span, students must generate and pursue personally relevant goals. This implies that teachers must.
choice1: group students according to type of goals.
choice2: share their personal goals with students.
choice3: show the relevance of lesson to students' goals.
choice4: segregate students without goals in order not to influence others
answerKey: show the relevance of lesson to students' goals.

question: What pedagogy should schools adopt to help learners acquire the basic skills?
choice1: Do community visits and let students do a project to improve the community.
choice2: Let students perform experiments and investigatory projects.
choice3: Let students make a webquest regarding a particular topic.
choice4: Demonstrate skills needed and then let students perform the skills until mastery is achieved.
answerKey: Demonstrate skills needed and then let students perform the skills until mastery is achieved.

question:
Which is/are example/s of positive classroom behaviors?
I. Make eye contact with each student.
II. Deliberately move toward and stand close to each student during the class
period.
III. Attribute the ownership of ideas to the students who initiated them.
IV. Call on students who do not commonly participate, not just those who
respond most frequently.
V. Provide appropriate wait time for all students to respond to questions,
regardless of their past performance or your perception of their abilities.
choice3: I, II, III, IV and V
answerKey: I, II, III, IV and V

question: Which of these “combination of classes” is organized in places where the required number of pupils of the same grade levels has not met the required number to make up a separate class thus the teacher apportions class time for instruction to every grade level within the class?
The students’ attention from the lesson was swayed away due to Teacher’s Charry attending to a personal conversation with another teacher. What was manifested by Teacher Charry?
The students of Teacher Ann got bored due to the repetition of lessons. What behavior was manifested by Teacher Ann?

Research says that students develop greater efficacy for a learning task when
they see others like themselves performing the task successfully. This means students must be exposed to models	…
I.   of their age
II.  who come from similar cultural background
III. with similar socio-economic background
In the context of Piaget’s cognitive theory ,  to which do you attribute  a explain a kindergarten  inability  to see  reality  from others’ point of view?
Cultural or group influences on students can impact on learners' motivation, orientation toward learning, and ways of thinking. Which proves this?
choice1: Children who are products of interracial marriage are better motivated for learning.
choice2: The authoritarianism in Filipino homes contributes to docile children.
choice3: Children with weak biological make up are unmotivated for learning.
choice4: Learners with above average IQ are more motivated than those with below average IQ.
answerKey: The authoritarianism in Filipino homes contributes to docile children.

question: If teachers are serious with developing critical thinking and problem solving skill among Math students, which practices should be observed?
choice1: Emphasize on answers and not on how they solve the problem.
choice2: Let your students focus on algorithmic problem solving.
choice3: Direct students to make sense of problems and solve them.
answerKey: Direct students to make sense of problems and solve them.

question: In the context of the Theory of Multiple Intelligence, which is a weakness of the paper-pencil test?
choice2: It is not easy to administer.
choice4: It puts non-linguistically intelligent at a disadvantage.
answerKey: It puts non-linguistically intelligent at a disadvantage.

question: From  the  point of view of Bandura’s social  learning theory , what  is an effective  way  of  inculcating love for learning among  children?
choice2: Teacher  must serve as a  model for the  love of  learning .
choice3: Offer  Values Education as a separate   subject  in the curriculum.
choice4: Reward  children  who perform well in school.
answerKey: Teacher  must serve as a  model for the  love of  learning .

question:
How can teachers build strong relationships with passive students due to fear relationships and fear of failure?
I. Refrain from criticism
II. Reward small successes
III. Create classroom climate in which students feel safe from aggressive people

choice1: love by  all except for the principal
choice2: free enough to joke and laugh with students
choice3: fussy and teaches things over and over
answerKey: love by  all except for the principal

question: Teacher Janice’s approach towards her students is informal; she will have lunch with them, or even play with ball to them. According to Riessman, what type of teacher is she?
For the group guidance approach to classroom management, what element Is lacking when work is badly scheduled, badly sequenced or confusing?
If Teacher Nita committed “stimulus-bound”, what could be the most possible effect of it to her class?
choice1: the class will have trouble in re-engaging to the tasks at hand.
choice2: the lesson becomes boring and tiresome
choice3: the class will be confused and become inattentive
choice4: the lesson won’t be appreciated completely since it was chunked into smaller units
answerKey: the class will have trouble in re-engaging to the tasks at hand.

question: Teacher Jhenn use a great deal of discussion and a play a moderator role that enables her students to work on answers to problems by themselves. According to Thelen, what type of teaching styles does Teacher Jhenn applied?

The authoritarian setting in the Filipino home is reinforced by a classroom teacher who:
If you learn best through hands-on and touching the objects, what type of learner are you?
If students stop the behavior and then repeat it, their goal is __________.

choice1: solving the problem within time limit
choice2: getting the right answer to a world problem

question: On managing the class group, what is the problem when the class atmosphere is punitive, tinged with partiality, too competitive or to exclusive?
choice2: Group emotions such as fear, depression, etc.

question:
One group of four students was making sounds in the room while Teacher B was grading papers during silent reading. He did not know which group was making the sounds, so he warned the students that they would be inside for recess if it went on. The offending students knew he did not know who it was, so they kept it up to test the waters. Mr. B announced to the
class that if he heard noises one more time, the whole class would be in recess, regardless of who it was. The other students were very upset, and expressed, "That's not fair!". Was Teacher B's decision fair?
choice1: No, it was unfair to punish the whole class for the misdemeanor of one.
choice2: Yes, because the class seemed not to have cooperated to stop the misbehavior
choice3: Yes, to give a lesson to all.
choice4: No, but that was the only way to show to the class he means business.
answerKey: No, it was unfair to punish the whole class for the misdemeanor of one.

question: Students should feel that the teacher is aware of their behavior and alert to difficulties they may encounter. The extent of monitoring is correlated with the students’ academic ability and the related demands they make for the teacher’s attention.
choice1: Spend more time teaching and reteaching
choice4: Move around the room to monitor students’ seatwork
answerKey: Move around the room to monitor students’ seatwork

question: I teach  in a traditional school that subscribes to a  perennialist   and an essentialist  philosophy of education. Which is most likely  the curricular approach implemented?

choice2: Relax discipline early in the first weeks, being more tight later
choice4: Establish pattern of disciplinary early in the first weeks of school

question: If I have to use the most authentic method of assessment, which of these procedures should I consider?

They understand and can use a variety of strategies to help them reach learning and performance goals and to apply their knowledge in novel situations. They also continue to expand their repertoire of strategies by reflecting on the methods they use to see which work well for them. Which processes of successful learners are described above?
Teacher Jose talks to students about their interests, what they did over the weekend, their progress in school work, etc. What positive approach to classroom management did Teacher Jose apply?

I.	Reactive		II. Preventive	III. Proactive
If the children are cooperatively engaged with the teacher in a group project the children will discipline themselves as each member of the group exercises

choice1: knows her students well and their personal information.
choice2: knows well her subject matter and its content or coverage
choice3: takes action when discipline problems occur in the classroom
choice4: knows the ins and outs of co-teachers.
answerKey: takes action when discipline problems occur in the classroom

question: A limited vocabulary is a setback to efficient reading. What does this statement imply about the learner?
choice1: Be equipped with certain skills to attack unfamiliar words.
choice2: Master all lexical items in one language.
choice3: Know how to use the dictionary in locating meanings.
answerKey: Be equipped with certain skills to attack unfamiliar words.

question: While research on the use of praise is mixed, it is generally agreed that honest praise increases achievement and motivation. The following guidelines are effective in giving praise except
choice1: Focuses students’ attention on their own task-relevant behavior
choice3: It is restricted to global positive reaction
choice4: Shows spontaneity, variety and other signs of credibility
answerKey: It is restricted to global positive reaction

I.  She previews the text and makes predictions

III. asks clarifying questions

choice1: The accomplishment of the objectives is dependent of the plan

choice4: This is required of a teacher.
answerKey: The accomplishment of the objectives is dependent of the plan

choice2: Decide on the length of the test

question: Why does UbD insist on identifying assessment evidence of learning right after identifying desired learning results?
choice1: Teaching-learning becomes more focused and organized.

answerKey: Teaching-learning becomes more focused and organized.

question: Which one should a teacher avoid to produce an environment conducive for learning?

choice1: I transfer thought to another single idea
choice2: I ask myself, do I really understand this one idea?
choice3: I stay or mull over one idea.
answerKey: I ask myself, do I really understand this one idea?

question: Before grouping the students for instruction, teacher Carlo takes into account the particular race of the students, their ethnicity and religion. This small grouping could be based on which criteria?

At the start of a new term, Teacher Z wants to familiarize students with active research methods. She will use such methods throughout the semester, and she knows from previous experience that many students view research as abstract,
irrelevant, and oppressive work. She randomly assigns students to small groups. She encourages them to discuss any previous experiences they may have had in doing research as well as their expectations and concerns for the course. Each group then shares its experiences, expectations, and concerns as she records them on the chalkboard. In this manner, she is able to understand her students' perspectives and to increase their connection to one another and herself.
Which technique did Teacher Z employ to create a favorable learning climate?
choice1: She grouped the students according to ability.
choice3: She makes clear that only positive learning experiences should be shared in the group.
choice4: She promised not to make research work oppressive.

question: Which principle  in the use  of non-conventional technology  do I  fail to observe  if I choose computer-assisted instruction as a  teaching  strategy?

Which technique(s) enable(s) a teacher to identify and eventually assists students with interpersonal difficulties

choice1:
An instructional program geared to the level of the lowest quarter of the
class
choice2: A flexible program geared to individual needs
choice3: A sound acceleration and promotional policy
choice4: A well-prepared classroom for the students
answerKey: A flexible program geared to individual needs

question: According to Bellack’s Linguistic Behavior of Teacher in the Classroom, how do you call Mr. Irvin’s verbal behavior when he begins his English class by announcing the topic to be discussed?

choice2: Allowing others to dominate in the decision-making
choice4: Collaborating with others in the group
answerKey: Collaborating with others in the group

question: A teacher should not be a slave of his lesson plan. This means that:
choice1: Teacher is the best lesson plan designer
choice2: A teacher must be willing to depart from her lesson plan if students are interested in something other than her intended lesson
choice3: A teacher must be ready to depart from her lesson plan if she remembers something more interesting than what she earlier planned
choice4: A lesson plan must be followed by a teacher no matter what
answerKey: A teacher must be willing to depart from her lesson plan if students are interested in something other than her intended lesson

question: Which statement about guidance is false?
choice1: The classroom teacher is not part of the school guidance program since she is not trained to be a guidance counselor

answerKey: The classroom teacher is not part of the school guidance program since she is not trained to be a guidance counselor

question: When is praise effective? When it _______.

answerKey: provides information to students about their competence and the value of their accomplishments

question: Which  is an  application of  Edgar Dale’s Cone of Experience in teaching?
choice1: Teach  by  dwelling only  on the concrete
choice2: Begin  your lesson  with the abstract.
choice3: One  audio-visual aid  should be used with other audio-visual materials
choice4: Use one audio-visual aid at a time.
answerKey: One  audio-visual aid  should be used with other audio-visual materials

question: When would demonstration method be most appropriate?
choice1: You would like your students to be actively involved.
choice2: There are observers and want to find out the methods and strategies you use.
choice4: There is an oversupply of instructional materials.

question:
Which characterize successful learners?
I.   Active
II.  Goal-directed
III. Self-regulating
IV. Assume personal responsibility for contributing to their own learning.
To what problem type do students belong, who have difficulty due to low potential or lack of readiness rather than motivation to work?
Which  flows  from Kohlberg’s theory of moral development?
choice2: Using   the inculcation method of values education

question: What may be best to do when the lesson is done ahead of time allotment?

choice1: Often anxious, fearful or frustrated about quality work
answerKey: Often anxious, fearful or frustrated about quality work

question: When a teacher assures a high degree of “time on task” and “engaged time” for students, then the teacher is expected to use the ______________.
When a school decides to work on a thematic curriculum which should be out of the picture?
Which  practice  goes  with authentic assessment?
choice1: Make  students come up with a flow chart  to demonstrate a process.
choice2: Make students  check their own answers after a quiz.
choice3: Make students dance  tango to determine  if  they learned how to dance tango.
choice4: Make  students  recite  the multiplication table  to check for mastery.
answerKey: Make students dance  tango to determine  if  they learned how to dance tango.

question: What is the expected outcome in applying Positive Behavior Support teaching technique?

Which are proofs that students are engaged in a metacognitive process?
I.   Reflect on how they think and learn
II.  Set reasonable learning or performance goals
III. Select potentially appropriate learning strategies or methods, and monitor their progress toward these goals
What type of validity does the Pre-board examination possess if its results can explain how the students will likely perform in their licensure examination?
What does constructive alignment mean in outcomes -based lesson planning?
choice1: The learning outcomes are the bases of teaching-learning activities and assessment tasks.
choice2: The content is the basis for assessment tasks.
choice3: The assessment task is the basis of teaching methodology.
choice4: The content is the basis for teaching methodology and assessment tasks.
answerKey: The learning outcomes are the bases of teaching-learning activities and assessment tasks.

question: When should Teacher M undertake the task of setting up routine activities?
choice2: As soon as the students have adjusted to their schedule
choice3: On the very first day of school
